abstract: If Vivendi, the media conglomerate, sells its stake in NBC, does it make sense for the company to keep its empire intact?
snippet: If Vivendi, the media conglomerate, sells its stake in NBC, does it make sense for the company to keep its empire intact?
lead_paragraph: PARIS  Of the world’s biggest media companies, the one that might seem in the best position to ride out the recession is Vivendi, whose headquarters in the shadow of the Arc de Triomphe oversees a sprawling empire of music, pay television, video game and mobile phone businesses.

headline.main: Media Giant Wrestles With a Shifting Identity
headline.print_headline: Media Giant Wrestles With a Shifting Identity

abstract: A deal in the works to sell NBC to the cable operator Comcast would hardly qualify as an advertisement for G.E.’s vaunted management and capital allocation skills.
snippet: A deal in the works to sell NBC to the cable operator Comcast would hardly qualify as an advertisement for G.E.’s vaunted management and capital allocation skills.

headline.main: The Worth of NBC as a Piece of G.E.
headline.print_headline: The Worth of NBC as a Piece of G.E.

byline.original: By Rob Cox and Aliza Rosenbaum

abstract: The value of General Electric’s possible deal to sell control of NBC Universal to Comcast means that G.E. may have paid billions of dollars more over the years to build NBC than it will get back, Breakingviews.com says.
snippet: The value of General Electric’s possible deal to sell control of NBC Universal to Comcast means that G.E. may have paid billions of dollars more over the years to build NBC than it will get back, Breakingviews.com says.
lead_paragraph: General Electric at long last appears ready to part with NBC Universal, the media and entertainment business it assembled through 24 years of management effort — and at least $33 billion of shareholders’ money. A reported deal in the works with the cable operator Comcast that could value NBC at around $24 billion wouldn’t be a big disaster, Breakingviews.com says. But, the Web site says, it would hardly qualify as an advertisement for G.E.’s vaunted management and capital allocation skills.

headline.main: How Much Has NBC Cost G.E.?

abstract: Peter Chernin, the former News Corporation president, is advising Comcast in its bid to acquire a majority stake in NBC Universal, according to executives briefed on the matter.
snippet: Peter Chernin, the former News Corporation president, is advising Comcast in its bid to acquire a majority stake in NBC Universal, according to executives briefed on the matter.
lead_paragraph: Peter Chernin, the former president of News Corporation and one of the highest profile media executives not tethered to a major conglomerates, is advising Comcast in its bid to acquire a majority stake in NBC Universal, according to executives briefed on the matter who spoke anonymously because Mr. Chernin’s role in the deal was meant to be private.

headline.main: A Surprise Adviser for Comcast Bid: Peter Chernin

abstract: Peter Chernin, former president of the News Corporation, is advising Comcast in its bid to acquire a majority stake in NBC Universal, according to executives briefed on the matter.
snippet: Peter Chernin, former president of the News Corporation, is advising Comcast in its bid to acquire a majority stake in NBC Universal, according to executives briefed on the matter.
lead_paragraph: From Tim Arango at Media Decoder:

headline.main: Surprise Adviser for Comcast Bid: Peter Chernin
